definition: not yet/did not/have not/not/8th earthly branch: 1-3 p.m., 6th solar month (7th July-6th August), year of the Sheep/ancient Chinese compass point: 210°
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: Modern cosmology does show that there are so many unsolved mysteries to sciences.
sentences.chinese: 现代宇宙学的确展现了很多科学未解之迷。

sentences.english: Due to the lack of historical reference, there exists a puzzle about Liu Zongyuan's marriage.
sentences.chinese: 柳宗元的婚姻问题，由于缺乏史料存在未解之谜。

sentences.english: But, he cautions, there are still many unanswered questions.
sentences.chinese: 但他也提醒道，还有很多未解的问题。

sentences.english: "It's been exciting trying to solve a mystery that has resisted solution for sixty years," Jackson said.
sentences.chinese: 尝试解决这一六十年的未解之谜让我觉得很高兴。

sentences.english: Two death, heart was not broken.
The second one is a total mystery.
sentences.chinese: 第二个是至今仍毫无头绪的未解之谜。

sentences.english: With no remaining mysteries, the scientific journey would halt.
sentences.chinese: 没有了未解之谜，科学的旅程就戛然而止。

sentences.english: One mystery is the virus's origins.
sentences.chinese: 一个未解之谜是该病毒的起源。

sentences.english: The fans are still curious mysteries of the modern plague.
sentences.chinese: 未解的迷仍然困扰着好奇的现代人。

definition: hard to solve/hard to dispel/hard to understand/hard to undo
to seek an answer/to look for an explanation/to explain/explanation
to remain puzzled after pondering over sth a hundred times (idiom)/to remain perplexed despite much thought
to dispel doubts/to clear up difficulties
